newsitem.title: UK: Wray consortium to make 17.75 mln stg Forest bid.
newsitem.headline: Wray consortium to make 17.75 mln stg Forest bid.

text.p: A consortium including property developer Nigel Wray is finalising a 17.75 million stg bid for English Premier League soccer club Nottingham Forest, a spokesman for the group said on Tuesday.
A further 20 million stg could be raised by a flotation "six months or so down the line", the spokesman said.

The consortium, which also includes former Tottenham Hotspur chairman Irving Scholar, plans an immediate injection of 11 million stg in new shareholder funds plus a four million stg loan stock facility.

The consortium would offer Forest's 209 shareholders a 20 percent participation in the new company or a cash alternative of 13,500 stg per share. It expects to circulate details of the offer to shareholders by the end of the week.

The future of the club was left unresolved by an EGM on Monday night at which a 13 million stg offer from a rival consortium led by businessman Sandy Anderson failed to secure the required 75 percent majority support.
The situation is also being monitored by a group of investors represented by Albert Scardino, a London-based American journalist.

Scardino said that his grouping of North American and UK media investors was looking at the possibility of coming up with a bid which would make business sense and win the support of existing shareholders.
"By the end of the week we should know if we have sufficient backing to come forward with our own offer or to merge our bid with other ones," Scardino said.
